snippet: The Sindh Rangers, a paramilitary force, have curbed violence in Karachi, but they are now targeting political parties at odds with the nation’s military establishment.
abstract: Sindh Rangers, a paramilitary force that reports to Pakistani military command, has been used by authorities in Karachi, Pakistan, to bolster work of national police force and intervene in politically-driven violence by armed gangs; crime in Karachi has reportedly dropped significantly since Rangers have begun operations.

byline.contributor: Salman Masood contributed reporting from Islamabad.

lead_paragraph: The Sindh Rangers, a paramilitary force, have curbed violence in Karachi, but they are now targeting political parties at odds with the nation’s military establishment.

headline.main: Crime Down in Karachi, Paramilitary in Pakistan Shifts Focus
headline.print_headline: Crime Now Down, Paramilitary in Pakistan Shifts Focus to Political Parties
